commands.info: Navigate to MISSION.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT

params.info: Hold time in decimal seconds. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at MISSION for rotary wing)
params.name: param_1

params.info: Acceptance radius in meters (if the sphere with this radius is hit, the MISSION counts as reached)
params.name: param_2

params.info: 0 to pass through the WP, if > 0 radius in meters to pass by WP. Positive value for clockwise orbit, negative value for counter-clockwise orbit. Allows trajectory control.
params.name: param_3

params.info: Desired yaw angle at MISSION (rotary wing)
params.name: param_4

commands.info: Loiter around this MISSION an unlimited amount of time
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_UNLIM

params.info: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise
params.name: param_3

commands.info: Loiter around this MISSION for X turns
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TURNS

params.info: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise
params.name: param_3

commands.info: Loiter around this MISSION for X seconds
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TIME

params.info: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise
params.name: param_3

commands.info: Return to launch location
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RETURN_TO_LAUNCH

commands.info: Land at location
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND

commands.info: Takeoff from ground / hand
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF

params.info: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor
params.name: param_1

params.info: Yaw angle (if magnetometer present), ignored without magnetometer
params.name: param_4

commands.info: 'Continue on the current course and climb/descend to specified altitude.  When the altitude is reached continue to the next command (i.e., don''t proceed to the next command until the desired altitude is reached.'
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_CONTINUE_AND_CHANGE_ALT

commands.info: 'Begin loiter at the specified Latitude and Longitude.  If Lat=Lon=0, then loiter at the current position.  Don''t consider the navigation command complete (don''t leave loiter) until the altitude has been reached.  Additionally, if the Heading Required parameter is non-zero the  aircraft will not leave the loiter until heading toward the next waypoint. '
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TO_ALT

params.info: Radius in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, negative counter-clockwise, 0 means no change to standard loiter.
params.name: param_2

commands.info: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI

params.info: Region of intereset mode. (see MAV_ROI enum)
params.name: param_1

params.info: MISSION index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
params.name: param_2

params.info: ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
params.name: param_3

params.info: x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)
params.name: param_5

commands.info: Control autonomous path planning on the MAV.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PATHPLANNING

params.info: '0: Disable local obstacle avoidance / local path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable local path planning, 2: Enable and reset local path planning'
params.name: param_1

params.info: '0: Disable full path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable, 2: Enable and reset map/occupancy grid, 3: Enable and reset planned route, but not occupancy grid'
params.name: param_2

params.info: Yaw angle at goal, in compass degrees, [0..360]
params.name: param_4

commands.info: Navigate to MISSION using a spline path.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SPLINE_WAYPOINT

params.info: Hold time in decimal seconds. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at MISSION for rotary wing)
params.name: param_1

commands.info: hand control over to an external controller
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_GUIDED_ENABLE

commands.info: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the NAV/ACTION commands in the enumeration
commands.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAST

commands.info: Delay mission state machine.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DELAY

commands.info: Ascend/descend at rate.  Delay mission state machine until desired altitude reached.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_CHANGE_ALT

commands.info: Delay mission state machine until within desired distance of next NAV point.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DISTANCE

commands.info: Reach a certain target angle.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_YAW

params.info: speed during yaw change:[deg per second]
params.name: param_2

commands.info: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the CONDITION commands in the enumeration
commands.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_LAST

commands.info: Set system mode.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE

params.info: Mode, as defined by ENUM MAV_MODE
params.name: param_1

params.info: Custom mode - this is system specific, please refer to the individual autopilot specifications for details.
params.name: param_2

commands.info: Jump to the desired command in the mission list.  Repeat this action only the specified number of times
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP

commands.info: Change speed and/or throttle set points.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED

commands.info: Changes the home location either to the current location or a specified location.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME

params.info: Use current (1=use current location, 0=use specified location)
params.name: param_1

commands.info: Set a system parameter.  Caution!  Use of this command requires knowledge of the numeric enumeration value of the parameter.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER

commands.info: Set a relay to a condition.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_RELAY

params.info: Setting (1=on, 0=off, others possible depending on system hardware)
params.name: param_2

commands.info: Cycle a relay on and off for a desired number of cyles with a desired period.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_RELAY

commands.info: Set a servo to a desired PWM value.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_SERVO

commands.info: Cycle a between its nominal setting and a desired PWM for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_SERVO

commands.info: Terminate flight immediately
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FLIGHTTERMINATION

commands.info: 'Mission command to perform a landing. This is used as a marker in a mission to tell the autopilot where a sequence of mission items that represents a landing starts. It may also be sent via a COMMAND_LONG to trigger a landing, in which case the nearest (geographically) landing sequence in the mission will be used. The Latitude/Longitude is optional, and may be set to 0/0 if not needed. If specified then it will be used to help find the closest landing sequence.'
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAND_START

commands.info: Mission command to perform a landing from a rally point.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_RALLY_LAND

commands.info: Mission command to safely abort an autonmous landing.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GO_AROUND

commands.info: Control onboard camera system.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CONTROL_VIDEO

params.info: 'Transmission mode: 0: video stream, >0: single images every n seconds (decimal)'
params.name: param_3

commands.info: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI

params.info: Region of intereset mode. (see MAV_ROI enum)
params.name: param_1

params.info: MISSION index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
params.name: param_2

params.info: ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
params.name: param_3

params.info: x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)
params.name: param_5

commands.info: Mission command to configure an on-board camera controller system.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONFIGURE

params.info: 'Shutter speed: Divisor number for one second'
params.name: param_2

params.info: Main engine cut-off time before camera trigger in seconds/10 (0 means no cut-off)
params.name: param_7

commands.info: Mission command to control an on-board camera controller system.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONTROL

params.info: Zooming step value to offset zoom from the current position
params.name: param_3

commands.info: Mission command to configure a camera or antenna mount
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE

commands.info: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL

params.info: pitch or lat in degrees, depending on mount mode.
params.name: param_1

params.info: roll or lon in degrees depending on mount mode
params.name: param_2

params.info: yaw or alt (in meters) depending on mount mode
params.name: param_3

commands.info: Mission command to set CAM_TRIGG_DIST for this flight
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST

commands.info: Mission command to enable the geofence
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FENCE_ENABLE

commands.info: Mission command to trigger a parachute
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PARACHUTE

params.info: action (0=disable, 1=enable, 2=release, for some systems see PARACHUTE_ACTION enum, not in general message set.)
params.name: param_1

commands.info: Change to/from inverted flight
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_INVERTED_FLIGHT

commands.info: 'Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount, using a quaternion as reference.'
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL_QUAT

commands.info: set id of master controller
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_MASTER

commands.info: set limits for external control
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_LIMITS

params.info: timeout - maximum time (in seconds) that external controller will be allowed to control vehicle. 0 means no timeout
params.name: param_1

params.info: absolute altitude min (in meters, AMSL) - if vehicle moves below this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue.  0 means no lower altitude limit
params.name: param_2

params.info: absolute altitude max (in meters)- if vehicle moves above this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue.  0 means no upper altitude limit
params.name: param_3

params.info: horizontal move limit (in meters, AMSL) - if vehicle moves more than this distance from it's location at the moment the command was executed, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no horizontal altitude limit
params.name: param_4

commands.info: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the DO commands in the enumeration
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAST

commands.info: Trigger calibration. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_CALIBRATION

commands.info: Set sensor offsets. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_SET_SENSOR_OFFSETS

params.info: 'Sensor to adjust the offsets for: 0: gyros, 1: accelerometer, 2: magnetometer, 3: barometer, 4: optical flow, 5: second magnetometer'
params.name: param_1

params.info: X axis offset (or generic dimension 1), in the sensor's raw units
params.name: param_2

params.info: Y axis offset (or generic dimension 2), in the sensor's raw units
params.name: param_3

params.info: Z axis offset (or generic dimension 3), in the sensor's raw units
params.name: param_4

params.info: Generic dimension 4, in the sensor's raw units
params.name: param_5

params.info: Generic dimension 5, in the sensor's raw units
params.name: param_6

params.info: Generic dimension 6, in the sensor's raw units
params.name: param_7

commands.info: Request storage of different parameter values and logs. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE

params.info: 'Parameter storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM'
params.name: param_1

params.info: 'Mission storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM'
params.name: param_2

commands.info: Request the reboot or shutdown of system components.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN

params.info: '0: Do nothing for autopilot, 1: Reboot autopilot, 2: Shutdown autopilot.'
params.name: param_1

params.info: '0: Do nothing for onboard computer, 1: Reboot onboard computer, 2: Shutdown onboard computer.'
params.name: param_2

commands.info: Hold / continue the current action
commands.name: MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO

params.info: 'MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD: hold MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE: continue with next item in mission plan'
params.name: param_1

params.info: 'MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION: Hold at current position MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION: hold at specified position'
params.name: param_2

params.info: MAV_FRAME coordinate frame of hold point
params.name: param_3

commands.info: start running a mission
commands.name: MAV_CMD_MISSION_START

params.info: 'first_item: the first mission item to run'
params.name: param_1

params.info: 'last_item:  the last mission item to run (after this item is run, the mission ends)'
params.name: param_2

commands.info: Arms / Disarms a component
commands.name: MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM

commands.info: Starts receiver pairing
commands.name: MAV_CMD_START_RX_PAIR

commands.info: Request autopilot capabilities
commands.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_AUTOPILOT_CAPABILITIES

commands.info: Start image capture sequence
commands.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_START_CAPTURE

params.info: Duration between two consecutive pictures (in seconds)
params.name: param_1

params.info: Number of images to capture total - 0 for unlimited capture
params.name: param_2

params.info: Resolution in megapixels (0.3 for 640x480, 1.3 for 1280x720, etc)
params.name: param_3

commands.info: Stop image capture sequence
commands.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_STOP_CAPTURE

commands.info: Enable or disable on-board camera triggering system.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_DO_TRIGGER_CONTROL

params.info: Trigger enable/disable (0 for disable, 1 for start)
params.name: param_1

commands.info: Starts video capture
commands.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_START_CAPTURE

params.info: Camera ID (0 for all cameras), 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.
params.name: param_1

params.info: Resolution in megapixels (0.3 for 640x480, 1.3 for 1280x720, etc)
params.name: param_3

commands.info: Stop the current video capture
commands.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_STOP_CAPTURE

commands.info: Create a panorama at the current position
commands.name: MAV_CMD_PANORAMA_CREATE

params.info: Viewing angle horizontal of the panorama (in degrees, +- 0.5 the total angle)
params.name: param_1

params.info: Viewing angle vertical of panorama (in degrees)
params.name: param_2

params.info: Speed of the horizontal rotation (in degrees per second)
params.name: param_3

params.info: Speed of the vertical rotation (in degrees per second)
params.name: param_4

commands.info: Deploy payload on a Lat / Lon / Alt position. This includes the navigation to reach the required release position and velocity.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_PREPARE_DEPLOY

params.info: 'Operation mode. 0: prepare single payload deploy (overwriting previous requests), but do not execute it. 1: execute payload deploy immediately (rejecting further deploy commands during execution, but allowing abort). 2: add payload deploy to existing deployment list.'
params.name: param_1

params.info: Desired approach vector in degrees compass heading (0..360). A negative value indicates the system can define the approach vector at will.
params.name: param_2

params.info: Desired ground speed at release time. This can be overriden by the airframe in case it needs to meet minimum airspeed. A negative value indicates the system can define the ground speed at will.
params.name: param_3

params.info: Minimum altitude clearance to the release position in meters. A negative value indicates the system can define the clearance at will.
params.name: param_4

params.info: Latitude unscaled for MISSION_ITEM or in 1e7 degrees for MISSION_ITEM_INT
params.name: param_5

params.info: Longitude unscaled for MISSION_ITEM or in 1e7 degrees for MISSION_ITEM_INT
params.name: param_6

commands.info: Control the payload deployment.
commands.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_CONTROL_DEPLOY

params.info: 'Operation mode. 0: Abort deployment, continue normal mission. 1: switch to payload deploment mode. 100: delete first payload deployment request. 101: delete all payload deployment requests.'
params.name: param_1

traits.info: Commands to be executed by the MAV. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This command list is similar what ARINC 424 is for commercial aircraft: A data format how to interpret waypoint/mission data.
traits.name: Mavlink
